intro: Cissampelos nephrophylla, commonly known as the kidneyleaf moonvine, is a climbing plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds, and it often thrives in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
